intro: Urachne racemosa, commonly known as the clustered uracha, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the family Aizoaceae, commonly referred to as the ice plant family. The plant is characterized by its succulent, fleshy stems and leaves, which are adapted to arid environments. It produces small, clustered flowers that are typically yellow or orange in color. Urachne racemosa is often found in rocky or sandy soils and is well-suited to drought conditions.
